questions.prompt: Which types of lightbulbs do you most commonly use in your household?
questions.advice: Switch to LED lightbulbs. They consume less light, last longer and produce a cleaner light.

questions.prompt: When your home feels chilly, what do you usually do?
answers: Put on extra layers of clothes or use a blanket
questions.advice: Electric heating wastes energy. Consider alternative ways of staying warm, like a blanket.

questions.prompt: How often do you hang clothes to dry instead of using your dryer?
answers: When I only have a couple of items
questions.advice: Dryers are inefficient. Hanging your clothes to dry consumes far less energy.

questions.prompt: How long do your showers usually last?
questions.advice: Take quicker showers to waste less water.

questions.prompt: During the day, how do you prefer to light your home?
questions.advice: When natural lighting is available, turning off the lights can save energy.

questions.prompt: How do you get to work most often?
answers: I do not commute to work or I work from home
questions.advice: Vehicles produce large amounts of carbon emissions. Walking or biking is a more efficient alternative.

questions.prompt: What type of vehicle do you use most often?
answers: I do not drive a car
questions.advice: Hydrogen and electric cars are more efficient than gas. However, walking consumes the least energy.

questions.prompt: When presented with an escalator, an elevator, or stairs, which do you choose?
questions.advice: The energy costs of escalators and elevators can stack up. Taking the stairs is less wasteful.

questions.prompt: When you're buying groceries, which bags do you use most often?
questions.advice: Paper is better than plastic. However, reusable bags are the least wasteful, especially ones made from LDPE or NWPP.

questions.prompt: Where do you most often get drinking water?
questions.advice: If the tap water is potable where you live, it's far better to drink than bottled in terms of waste.

questions.prompt: Where do you prefer to buy new clothes for your wardrobe?
answers: Fast fashion sites like Shein or Forever21
questions.advice: Fast fashion stores are some of the worst for the environment. Second-hand clothes are much better for reducing waste.

questions.prompt: How often do you purchase additional clothing or beauty items?
questions.advice: The less clothes you buy, the less you waste. Consider cutting back on fashion purchases.

questions.prompt: If your clothing is damaged, what do you do?
answers: Buy new clothes to replace them
questions.advice: If you have the motor skills, learning enough sewing to patch your clothes is easier than you might think.

questions.prompt: If you're buying new makeup, where do you stand on animal testing?
answers: I don't buy or wear makeup
I am strongly against animal testing
I prefer if companies don't do it
It does not affect my decision to purchase
questions.advice: You should never support companies that use animal testing if you can help it. It's cruel and dangerous to the health of many of our friends.

questions.prompt: In your office or workspace, do you have a recycling bin for paper?
questions.advice: Putting a recycling bin in your office is a good way to remind yourself to recycle.

questions.prompt: When you're done using your computer for the day, what do you do?
questions.advice: Computers still draw phantom power unless they're completely plugged out, so doing so will save energy.

questions.prompt: Where applicable, have you opted to receive electronic statements and bills?
answers: No, I prefer to receive paper
Yes, I have opted to receive electronic versions
questions.advice: If you have a way of receiving e-statements, they produce far less paper waste.

questions.prompt: What do you do with your organic food waste?
questions.advice: Composting foods is more nurturing for the environment and reduces food waste. It's easier to get started than you might think.

questions.prompt: What kind of straws do you use?
questions.advice: Disposable straws create waste no matter the material. Reusable metal straws are better for the Earth.

questions.prompt: How do you wash your dishes?
questions.advice: Dishwashers waste water, and hot water wastes electricity. Washing dishes by hand with warm water is best.

questions.prompt: I turn off my lights when I'm not using them.
questions.advice: Turning off your lights before you leave wastes less power.

questions.prompt: I turn off my electronics before I go to bed.
questions.advice: Many electronics waste power overnight if you don't power them off.

questions.prompt: I wash my clothes by hand.
questions.advice: Washers waste lots of water and power. Handwashing is less wasteful.

questions.prompt: I avoid taking flights when an alternative exists.
questions.advice: Planes emit large amounts of carbon. Even driving is a far less wasteful alternative when traveling long distances.

questions.prompt: I encourage people to take the bus with me instead of driving me.
questions.advice: Change isn't just limited to you. Encouraging others with practices like using public transit also reduces emissions.

questions.prompt: I avoid pre-packaged foods if they're wrapped in plastic.
questions.advice: Pre-packaged foods are less wasteful if wrapped in paper. Avoid plastic packaging if possible.

questions.prompt: I buy my food from the farmer's market.
questions.advice: Along with supporting local businesses, buying local food saves carbon emissions thanks to not requiring transportation.

questions.prompt: I buy my food in bulk containers.
questions.advice: Not only can buying food in bulk save you money, it also wastes less packaging.

questions.prompt: I get my clothes second-hand.
questions.advice: Reusing clothes is less wasteful. It's better to get clothes second-hand.

questions.prompt: I make sure to donate my clothes when I don't want them anymore.
questions.advice: Donating clothes is good for helping those in need. It also results in less waste production.

questions.prompt: I research clothing brands to make sure they're ethical before I buy from them.
questions.advice: Staying aware of the brands you buy clothes from is important. Try to avoid supporting businesses with unethical practices.

questions.prompt: I print my pages double-sided.
questions.advice: Printing your pages double-sided takes half the paper.

questions.prompt: I avoid printing unless it's absolutely necessary.
questions.advice: Printing wastes paper, so try only to use it when you absolutely have to. Electronic communication is less wasteful.

questions.prompt: I unplug my work computer before I head out.
questions.advice: Even powered off computers consume some power. Make sure you unplug before heading out for the night.

questions.prompt: I make sure none of my leftovers go to waste.
questions.advice: There are plenty of creative ways to use leftovers. Minimize food waste when you can.

questions.prompt: I avoid using paper towels.
questions.advice: Disposable paper towels produce plenty of waste. Reusable rags are less impactful.

questions.prompt: I make my own coffee instead of ordering it.
questions.advice: The packaging associated with ordering coffee contributes to plastic waste. Making your own coffee is better.
